description: The proposed legal settlement by the NCAA and its Power Five conferences would allow schools to directly pay athletes. But questions remain, including whether men and women will be paid equally.
title: What we know and what we don't about a historic settlement to pay college athletes

description:
Iran laid the body of President Ebrahim Raisi to rest, after he died in a helicopter crash. Though thousands attended funeral ceremonies, we hear from Iranians who say he won't be remembered fondly.

And in South Korea, a propaganda video from North Korea is banned after it goes viral on TikTok.
title: Iranians React President's Death; North Korean Propaganda Goes Viral

description: Much sad. Kabosu, the Shiba Inu whose side-eyed look inspired countless memes, died on Friday, her owner said.
title: The Shiba Inu that inspired Dogecoin crypto and countless memes has died

description: The International Court of Justice in The Hague has no power to enforce Friday's ruling, but it adds international pressure on Israel.
title: The top U.N. court has ordered Israel to stop its Rafah military operation

description: In his inventive 2004 documentary about the fast food industry, Spurlock consumed only McDonald’s fast food for a month. He died Thursday from complications of cancer.
title: Morgan Spurlock, documentary filmmaker of 'Super Size Me', dies at 53

description: To people who watch high-level philanthropy, Florida A&M's embarrassing incident wasn't only a shocking reversal. It was something they've seen before. The school is now investigating what went wrong.
title: A mega-gift for an HBCU college fell through. Here's what happened — and what's next

description: Over three days, 14 people with different backgrounds from all over Wisconsin met in person to discuss abortion policy and discovered how far they could get.
title: Abortion can be difficult to talk about. These 14 strangers took it on anyway

description: Teacher retention and recruitment is difficult and some schools make use of J-1 Visas to recruit teachers from outside the U.S. In one rural school district in Alaska, foreign teachers make up over half the staff.
title: Visa program draws foreign teachers to a rural Alaska school district facing a staffing crisis
